title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 3.52 - Vacancies in institutions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 3.52 - Vacancies in institutions

State Regulations

In case the office of chief executive of an institution in
the university shall be vacant for one year without satisfactory excuse
therefor, the Regents may fill the vacancy. The person so appointed shall
continue in office during the pleasure of the Regents, and shall have the same
powers, salary, emoluments and privileges as his immediate predecessor in
office; or, if he had no immediate predecessor, he shall have such salary as
the Regents shall direct to be paid by such institution. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
3.52

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
